history.content:
186 TA here so might be slightly biased: I think 186 is probably one of the more important CS classes I have took so far in terms of SWE knowledge. I also really enjoyed 170, but I think it's helpfulness towards interviews is exaggerated, only the material in the first 1-2 months is relevant and all of it can be self-studied. I do still highly recommend taking 170 though. In terms of work load, I thought 186 has a lot more consistent work, and there is a stretch where there are 3-4 projects released back to back. 170 in general is pretty light, although the concepts are definitely trickier than 186's. Can't comment on 16B because I will also be taking it in the fall :P

If I had to choose between your options, I would probably choose between 1 or 2, 3 might be a bit rough because it is still 2 upper div CS classes + a high workload lower div. Hope this helps!

Originally, I was planning on taking CS186 + CS170 + 2 Econ upper div's, but as a rising junior who hasn't yet taken EE16B (I know, shame on me), these plans were derailed. As such, I was wondering if anybody could speak to whether the following workload would be realistic: EE16B + CS186 + CS170 + technical Econ class in conjunction with another. If this is unrealistic, which of the following alternatives would you recommend:

1. EE16B + CS186 + 2 Econ upper div's

2. EE16B + CS170 + 2 Econ upper div's

3. EE16B + CS186 + CS170 + very light breadth class

For context, I haven't taken EE16A since 2 years ago and I am abysmal at circuit-making, so I'm guessing that EE16B is going to occupy an inordinate amount of time for me. I also kept CS186 in both alternatives since I'd strongly prefer to have a coding class in the mix, but I hear CS170 could be useful for interviews, so I'm considering both options. Any insight would be appreciated!

Thanks in advance!
history.subject: Fall 2021 Semester Workload
